newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Chirac sees EU Commission limited to 20 members.
newsitem.headline: Chirac sees EU Commission limited to 20 members.

text.p: French President Jacques Chirac said on Friday he expected European Union (EU) members to agree to limit the number of members of the EU Commission to 20.

Chirac told a news conference in the Dutch resort of Noordwijk that France would have preferred a reduction in the number of commissioners from the present 20, but this had faced opposition from countries who feared losing a commission seat.
Chirac and German Chancellor Helmut Kohl had therefore proposed that the number of commissioners should be limited permanently to 20, even after new countries join the EU.
"We are going towards the Franco-German proposal limiting (the number) at 20," Chirac said.
EU leaders were meeting in Noordwijk to try to speed up negotiations on EU reforms so they can be incorporated in a treaty to be signed at a full summit next month in Amsterdam.
A key issue is the size of the Commission, the EU's executive body, after new members such as Poland, Hungary and the Czech Republic have been admitted.
